columns.name: nodegroup_name
columns.description: The name associated with an Amazon EKS managed node group.

columns.name: arn
columns.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) associated with the managed node group.

columns.name: cluster_name
columns.description: The name of the cluster that the managed node group resides in.

columns.name: created_at
columns.description: The Unix epoch timestamp in seconds for when the managed node group was created.

columns.name: status
columns.description: The current status of the managed node group.

columns.name: ami_type
columns.description: The AMI type that was specified in the node group configuration.

columns.name: capacity_type
columns.description: The capacity type of your managed node group.

columns.name: disk_size
columns.description: The disk size in the node group configuration.

columns.name: modified_at
columns.description: The Unix epoch timestamp in seconds for when the managed node group was last modified.

columns.name: node_role
columns.description: The IAM role associated with your node group.

columns.name: release_version
columns.description: If the node group was deployed using a launch template with a custom AMI, then this is the AMI ID that was specified in the launch template. For node groups that weren't deployed using a launch template, this is the version of the Amazon EKS optimized AMI that the node group was deployed with.

columns.name: version
columns.description: The Kubernetes version of the managed node group.

columns.name: health
columns.description: The health status of the node group.

columns.name: instance_types
columns.description: The instance type that is associated with the node group. If the node group was deployed with a launch template, then this is null.

columns.name: labels
columns.description: The Kubernetes labels applied to the nodes in the node group.

columns.name: launch_template
columns.description: If a launch template was used to create the node group, then this is the launch template that was used.

columns.name: remote_access
columns.description: The remote access configuration that is associated with the node group. If the node group was deployed with a launch template, then this is null.

columns.name: resources
columns.description: The resources associated with the node group, such as Auto Scaling groups and security groups for remote access.

columns.name: scaling_config
columns.description: The scaling configuration details for the Auto Scaling group that is associated with your node group.

columns.name: subnets
columns.description: The subnets that were specified for the Auto Scaling group that is associated with your node group.

columns.name: taints
columns.description: The Kubernetes taints to be applied to the nodes in the node group when they are created.

columns.name: update_config
columns.description: The node group update configuration.
